title: lor_starcutter
body:
[[Magolor]]'s blue starship. It serves as a safe area in [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]] and its [[kirby's_return_to_dream_land_deluxe|remake]], where [[Kirby]] will find [[copy ability]] rooms and Special Challenge stages.

On it first appearance, the Lor Starcutter crash-lands in Popstar, and Kirby and his friends agree to help Magolor help find its missing parts (both wings, oars, front emblem, and mast), along with the [[energy_sphere_(kirby)|energy spheres]] it dropped across the land. It can open portals to other dimensions, use its parts as projectiles, and is said to have a mind of its own.

title: sono_hanabira_ni_kuchizuke_wo
body:
[b]Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo[/b] (その花びらにくちづけを, lit. [i]A Kiss for the Petals[/i]) is a [[yuri]] game series by [[Fuguriya]].

There are also a number of light novels and drama CDs featuring each of the couples. A one-episode OVA based on the third game was released, sharing the same title.

h4. Games

* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo (1st game, feat. [[Matsubara Yuuna]] & [[Oda Nanami]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Watashi no Ouji-sama~ (2nd game, feat. ([[Kitajima Kaede]] & [[Kitajima Sara]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Atashi to Koibito Tsunagi~ (3rd game, feat. [[Kawamura Reo]] & [[Sawaguchi Mai]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Itoshisa no Photograph~ (4th game, feat. [[Kitajima Kaede]] & [[Kitajima Sara]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Anata wo Suki na Shiawase~ (5th game, feat. [[Kawamura Reo]] & [[Sawaguchi Mai]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Kuchibiru to Kisu de Tsubuyaite~ (6th game, feat. [[Matsubara Yuuna]] & [[Oda Nanami]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Amakute Hoshikute Torokeru Chu~ (7th game, feat. [[Suminoe Takako]] & [[Houraisen Runa]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Tenshi no Hanabira Zome~ (8th game, feat. [[Kirishima Shizuku]] & [[Shitogi Elis]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Amakute Otona Torokeru Chu~ (9th game, feat. [[Suminoe Takako]] & [[Houraisen Runa]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Lily Platinum~ (10th game, feat. [[Kirishima Shizuku]] & [[Shitogi Elis]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Mikaeru no Otome-tachi~ (11th game, feat. [[Matsubara Yuuna]], [[Oda Nanami]], [[Kitajima Kaede]], [[Kitajima Sara]], [[Kawamura Reo]], [[Sawaguchi Mai]], [[Suminoe Takako]], [[Houraisen Runa]], [[Kirishima Shizuku]], [[Shitogi Elis]], [[Azumi Risa]] & [[Ayase Miya]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Atelier no Koibito-tachi~ (12th game, feat. [[Azumi Risa]] & [[Ayase Miya]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Shirayuki no Kishi~ (13th game, feat. [[Matsubara Yuuna]], [[Oda Nanami]], [[Kitajima Kaede]], [[Kitajima Sara]], [[Kawamura Reo]], [[Sawaguchi Mai]], [[Azumi Risa]], [[Ayase Miya]], [[Shinozaki Rikka]] & [[Shirakawa Sayuki]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Anata ni Chikau Ai~ (14th game, feat. [[Kirishima Shizuku]], [[Shitogi Elis]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Deatta Koro no Omoide ni~ (15th game, feat. [[Azumi Risa]] & [[Ayase Miya]])
* Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo ~Hajimete Deatta Ano Hi Kara~ (16th game, feat. [[Azumi Risa]] & [[Ayase Miya]])

title: artery_gear
body:
Otherwise romanized as "Armor Girls", a Chinese mobile gacha game series, first developed under the original Flashwing. The first game, which ran from 2015 to 2017 and was localized as "Armor Girls Z Battle", was a "shooter RPG", utilizing 2D sprites in a pseudo-3D environment similar to a beat-'em-up. The tag is used for both the series as a whole, and the original game. [[Artery Gear: Fusion]], the follow-up game developed by Access Games, has its own tag.

h4. Character
* [[Della_(artery_gear)|]]
* [[Grace (artery gear)|]]
* [[Hearin_(artery_gear)|]]

h4. See also

title: say_so
body:
"Say So" is the fifth track on singer / songwriter Doja Cat's second studio album Hot Pink (2019) and was also released as the fifth single from the album (2020).  Gained exceptional popularity due to a viral dance on TikTok, and a number of parodies.

One popular parody of the song is "{{https://genius.com/Nyanners-seiso-lyrics|Seiso}}" by {{virtual_youtuber|vtuber}} {{nyatasha_nyanners|Nyanners}}.

title: otto_von_bismarck
body:
[b]Otto Eduard Leopold von Bismarck[/b] (April 1, 1815 – July 30, 1898) was the first Chancellor of the [[German Empire]]. He was known as the "Iron Chancellor" for his strong-willed personality, as well as his foreign and domestic political policies, which solidified Germany as a major European power.

h4. External links

title: number_41_bagooska_the_terribly_tired_tapir
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], resembles a [[tapir]] with {{tusks}}. Its OCG name is "Baguska the Intoxicated Demon Beast".

Notorious as a stall card used to prevent the opponent from activating their monster effects by forcing them into the defense position and negate their monster's activated effects, akin to how this monster put those all around it [[sleeping|asleep]].

The OCG release of Bagooska has it holding a {{wine bottle}} and {{drunk}}. The TCG release censored the artwork, changing the bottle to a {{pillow}}.

title: kuomintang
body:
The dominant ruling party of the Republic of [[China]] (1928–1987), having fled to [[Taiwan]] in 1949 after [[chinese civil war|fighting]] and failing to defeat the communists, establishing a decades-long dictatorship. Today, it remains a major centre-right political party, with their rival being the Democratic Progressive Party (DPP).

On Danbooru, this tag applies to posts that refer the following features:
* the Republic of China prior to 1949; 
* the Republic of China from 1949 to 1987; 
* KMT(-oriented) imagery. The party [[emblem]] consists of a white [[sun symbol]] with 12 triangular rays around it over a blue field.

h4. See also
* [[National Revolutionary Army]]
* [[Republic of China flag]]

h4. External links
* "Official website":[http://www.kmt.org.tw/]
* "Wikipedia: Kuomintang":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuomintang]

title: chaos_(sonic)
body:
A character from the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series, known as the God of Destruction. He is a liquid entity with long, extendible limbs and a [[brain]] visible through his head.
Chaos was the first known protector of the [[Master Emerald]], thousands of years before [[Knuckles the Echidna]].
In his first appearance in [[Sonic Adventure]], [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] and his friends must fight Chaos multiple times as he grows in size and power after consuming [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]] while temporarily under [[Dr. Eggman]]'s control.

title: rt-2pm2
body:
Also known as the Topol-M, the RT-2PM2 is famous from its InterContinental Ballistic Missile (or ICBM for acronym). It is currently used by the Russian Federation under the Strategic Rocket Forces. 

The Missile that it carries itself is Cold-launch and are Mobile ICBM Launchers, equipped with Nuclear Tips which can cause massive Radiation. These missiles can strike Globally including the United States.

title: hesco_concertainer
body: A type of temporary construction element (technically speaking, a "gabion") consisting of a wire-mesh cage with a heavy-duty fabric liner. Multiple Concertainers set up and filled with earth, crushed rock, or other such material can be used as improvised fortiifcations, a more common implementation than their originally intended purpose, erosion control. The name "HESCO" comes from the company originally set up to market the modern form of the device following its invention in the 1980s.

Affectionate [[teasing]], [[flirting]], long [[eye contact]] and other similar gestures to build up the mood to [[sex]].

title: stg45
body:
The [b]StG45[/b] ([i]Sturmgewehr 45[/i]) was a prototype German [[assault rifle]] which was developed in very late stages of World War II, firing 7.92×33mm Kurz round. Using roller-delayed blowback mechanism, it became the development basis for the [[CETME Model 58|CETME]] and [[h&k g3|G3]] [[rifle]]s. 

The [[weapon]] is visually recognizable by its tubular forearm, lack of external gas piston rod and tall rear sight block.
This tag also applies to all variants of the StG45, not only the original Mauser-designed StG45(M).

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[StG44]]
* [[Volkssturmgewehr]]

h1. External links

title: toyota_ts050
body:
A hybrid [[Le Mans Prototype]] built by [[Toyota]]. Powered by a twin-turbocharged 2.4l V6 engine and two electric motors totaling over 1000 hp, the TS050 represented over 20 years of development and trials to achieve victory at the prestigious 24 hour race.

Alongside the [[Mazda 787B]] Group C monster and [[Toyota GR010]] hypercar, the TS050 is one of three Japanese cars to have taken outright victory at Le Mans, and the only one to have done so twice.

title: for_the_better_right?_(meme)
body:
"For the Better, Right?," also known as the [[Anakin Skywalker|Anakin]] and [[Padme Amidala|Padme]] 4-Panel and Clueless Padme, is an exploitable image macro format based on screenshots from the 2002 film [[Star Wars]] [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones|Episode II – Attack of the Clones]].

The [[meme]] format is arranged in a [[square 4koma|common four-panel layout]], with the setup, response and punchline in the following panels. Differing from other four-panel memes, the punchline and setup are combined in the first panel, with the other panels being auxiliary.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: For the Better, Right?":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/for-the-better-right

title: nascar
body:
An American [[racecar|stock car]] [[racing]] series, and the most popular motorsports series in the United States. NASCAR consists of three primary leagues (Cup Series, Xfinity Series, and Truck Series), and also has international leagues in Canada, Mexico, Europe, and Brazil.

NASCAR is particularly known for their races around paved oval [[racetrack]]s, but the league also features events on road courses, dirt ovals, and street courses. [[Chevrolet]], [[Ford]], and [[Toyota]] are the only currently participating manufacturers, with [[Dodge (company)|]] and [[Pontiac]] being notable former competitors.

The series' most prestigious event and season opener is the [[daytona international speedway|Daytona 500]].

title: blood_alone
body:
Blood Alone is a manga series written and illustrated by [[Takano Masayuki]] .  The series was originally a doujin manga before being licensed and published until volume 10.  The licensed manga was discontinued, but the author continued the series from volume 11 onward again as a doujin manga.

The series follows the adult [[Kuroe Kurose]] and the young adolescent [[Misaki Minato]] as they live together in modern-day Yokohama.  Kurue is a former vampire hunter, turned private detective and author, while Misaki Minato is a young girl who was recently turned into a vampire.  The series revolves around the supernatural situations that Kurue gets involved in and Misaki's struggles as she comes to terms with her vampire nature and her love towards Kurue.

Note: While Kuroe Kurose (黒瀬クロエ) could also be translated as Chloe (クロエ, kuroe), it is intentionally left as Kuroe in the official translation, somewhat in part to distinguish him from his mentor the sorceress Chloe.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Blood Alone":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_Alone]

title: voyager_probe
body:
Images depicting either Voyager 1 or Voyager 2, interstellar probes built by [[NASA]] as a part of the Voyager Program and launched in 1977.  The twin probes were launched to take advantage of a favorable planetary alignment that occurs every 175 years which allowed the probes to swing by multiple planets on their journey to beyond the solar system.  Voyager 1 flew by Jupiter and Saturn and Voyager 2 flew by Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.  Voyager 1 entered into interstellar space in 2012, making it the first spacecraft to do so.

The voyager probes had a [[Voyager Golden Record|Golden Record]] placed on them, a phonograph record that contains sounds and images selected to portray the diversity of life and culture on Earth, and are intended for any intelligent extraterrestrial life form who may find them. The records are a time capsule.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Voyager program":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voyager_program]
* "Wikipedia: Voyager 1":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voyager_1]
* "Wikipedia: Voyager 2":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voyager_2]

title: honjou_kirou
body:
[b]Honjou Kirou[/b] (1901 - April 21, 1990) was an aircraft designer and engineer who worked with Mitsubishi (and [[Horikoshi Jirou]]) during [[World War II]]. He was Jirou's senior in the company and co-designed several bomber aircraft of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], namely the [[G3M|Mitsubishi G3M]] and [[G4M]]. 

He appears in the 2013 film [i][[Kaze Tachinu]][/i] ([i]The Wind Rises[/i]) albeit he is incorrectly portrayed as a close colleague of Jirou. He is voiced by Nishijima Hidetoshi (JP) and John Krasinski (EN). 

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiro_Honjo]

title: giovanni_battista_caproni
body:
[b]Giovanni Battista Caproni[/b] (July 3, 1886 – October 27, 1957) was an [[Italy|Italian]] aircraft engineer who developed both passenger and combat aircraft, the latter with the [[Regia Aeronautica]] during [[World War I]] and [[World War II|II]]. He was also given the noble title [b]Count of Taliedo[/b] during the interwar period.

He is a character in the 2013 film [i][[Kaze Tachinu]][/i] ([i]The Wind Rises[/i]), where he was voiced by Mansai Nomura (JP) and Stanley Tucci (EN).

title: car_wash_(place)
body:
A car wash is a location where there are either equipment or attendants in which you can exchange money to wash your car.  Should be identifiable either with a dedicated facility with equipment for washing a car in the case of an automatic car wash and a self-serve car wash, or signage advertising car wash service in the case of a hand car wash. Facilities may come in the shape of a long garage-shaped building in the case of an automated car wash, or a gas station-esque space with several bays featuring hand equipment for self-serve.

h6. Types

* Automatic Car Wash: A car wash with automated spinning brushes and/or sprayers wash a car.  The car may move by means of a conveyor or the equipment might move along the car by rail.
* Self-Serve Car Wash: A facility with several covered bays where a person can bring their car and pay to use a sprayer wand and other equipment, frequently coin-operated.
* Hand Car Wash: A facility or event, frequently fundraiser, where a person can bring their car and pay people using usually simple equipment, such as hose, bucket, and sponge, to wash their car.

h4. See also

* [[cleaning]]

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Car wash":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Car_wash]

title: sanat_kumara_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Mennsuke]]

This legendary delinquent leader hails from Umamichi Academy in Taito Ward. His passionate cries echo throughout the school on a daily basis, calling on its students to live their one and only youths to the fullest. He boasts an honorable, chivalrous, and spirited personality, and has garnered the trust of many of his schoolmates and teachers by rounding up the rowdy students of the academy and organizing them under a strict code of conduct. He has taken it upon himself to watch over his wayward underclassmen. At the same time, however, he can't conceal his hope that one day, someone who can surpass him will appear. While he seems invincible, mentioning his years held back seems to deal critical psychic damage.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Sanat Kumara":https://housamo.wiki/Sanat_Kumara

title: le_silence_de_la_mer
body:
[b][i]Le Silence de la mer[/i][/b] (The Silence of the Sea) is a [[france|French]] novel written during the summer of 1941 and published in early 1942 by Jean Bruller (Vercors). Published secretly in [[World War II]]-era German-occupied [[Paris]], the book quickly became a symbol of mental resistance against Axis occupiers.

This also refers to the adaptations based on the novel, such as:
* A 2004 French–Belgian TV film based on the novel with the same name, was shot from 1 to 28 April 2004 in Tusson and directed by Pierre Boutron for France 2 television. The actors are Julie Delarme ([[jeanne larosiere|Jeanne Larosière]]), Michel Galabru (André Larosière), Thomas Jouannet ([[Werner Von Ebrennac]]), Marie Bunel (Marie) and Timothée Ferrand (Pierre).

h1. External links

title: book_of_the_cafe
body:
連縁カフェ (Len'en Cafe) ~ BOOK of the CAFE
("Connecting Link Cafe")

Fifth game of the [[Len'en]] series, released in its alpha state on April 4th, 2020, its beta state on June 9th, 2021, and finally releasing in full on June 2nd, 2023. Unlike all prior games, this one isn't a shooter. It's a cafe management gacha game with tactical RPG elements on Android where you recruit Len'en characters as either cafe units or combat units.

title: higeki_no_genkyou_tonaru_saikyou_gedou_last_boss_joou_wa_tami_no_tame_ni_tsukushimasu
body:
Higeki no Genkyou tonaru Saikyou Gedou Last Boss Joou wa Tami no Tame ni Tsukushimasu (Eng. Title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior) is a 2018-to-Present webnovel and 2019-to-Present light novel by Tenichi with illustrations by Suzunosuke.  It has been adapted into a manga illustrated by Matsuura Bunko and a Summer 2023 TV anime by OLM Team Yoshioka.

The series follows the female protagonist, a senior in high school, who dies in an accident and awakens to find herself as the young first princess of the Kingdom of Freesia, Pride Royal Ivy, the girl who would became the villainous lost boss of the first game of the Our Ray of Light (ORL) series.  Haunted by memories and nightmares of the things the original Pride did in the game, she strives to spare and save the people the original Pride made suffer in the time she has has left before she expects to die when she reaches the point when the game ends.

h4. Main Characters

* [[Pride Royal Ivy]], First Princess of Freesia
* [[Stale Royal Ivy]], First Prince of Freesia
* [[Tiara Royal Ivy]], Second Princess of Freesia
* [[Arthur Beresford]], Knight

h4. Other Characters

* [[Alan Berners]], First Knight Squadron Captain
* [[Callum Bordeaux]], Third Knight Squadron Captain
* [[Eric Gilchrist]], First Knight Squadron Vice Captain
* [[Harrison Dirk]], Eighth Knight Squadron Captain

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Most_Heretical_Last_Boss_Queen]

title: ixion_saga_dt
body:
[i]Ixion Saga Dimensional Transfer [/i]

A Fall 2012 to Winter 2013 anime by Brain's Base based on the online game [[Ixion Saga]].  The anime was adapted into two manga series and a light novel series.

The series follows male protagonist Hokaze Kon, a hardcore video gamer who gets transported to another world after accepting a request from a female character in a video game.  Upon arriving in the other world he inadvertently saves princess Ecarlate Juptris Saint Piria and ends up accompanying her and her guards while she is trying to reach a neighboring country to marry its Prince and bring peace between their two countries.  He helps to protect her as she is being hunted down by a militant faction of her own country trying to capture her and prevent this.

h4. Characters

* [[Hokaze Kon]] (nicknamed DT, acronym for doutai, slang for male virgin)

title: kondo_wa_zettai_ni_jama_shimasen!
body:
Kondo wa Zettai ni Jama Shimasen! (English title: I swear I won't bother you again!) is a shoujo romance drama web novel, light novel, and manga series by Soratani Reina and illustrated by [[haru_(haru2079)|Harukawa Haru]].

The series follows the female protagonist [[Violette Rem Vahan]], eldest daughter of Duke Vahan, who blinded by hatred and resentment attempted to murder her half-sister Maryjune Rem Vahan.  Imprisoned and in despair, she regrets horribly her actions up to that point and wishes she could redo her life.  In a daze she becomes aware she has returned to the day that her father introduced his new wife and other daughter the 15-year-old Maryjune.  Vowing to not make the same mistakes again, she aims to no longer seek attention or affection and to live with the goal of not bothering anyone and to sever ties with her family by becoming a nun.  To achieve her goal though she must wait 2 more years to reach age 18, but must survive her household that had driven her mad the first time around with a hateful and demanding father; a half-sister who well-intentioned routinely drives home the disparity of treatment between the two and whose ignorance of noble society makes Violette's life more difficulty; and a step-mother who never intervenes but appears to always be keeping an eye on her.

title: sekomumasada_sensei
body:
Full name: センチメンタル小室マイケル坂本ダダ先生 (Sentimental Komuro Michael Sakamoto Dada-sensei)

One of the more popular and recognized NPCs from [[Yume Nikki]].  His signature characteristics are his monochrome-ness, clothes that only expose his head and neck (And sometimes his hands), and severely [[strabismus|lazy eyes]], both of which usually point away from each other diagonally.  In the game, he's found inside of a strange, white spaceship that contains a piano beneath a panoramic view of space, a table and some chairs, and a bed.

title: projectile_trail
body:
A visible trail that is left by or indicates a projectile's flight path. The most common example is the glowing trail of speeding bullet, which in real life is done by firing tracer ammunition. (see post #6371369)

This applies to any form of projectile (e.g. [[arrow (projectile)|]] on post #6271456 or [[throwing knife|throwing knives]] on post #4981382), and somehow can be rendered as a subset of [[speed lines]].

title: uss_lexington_(cv-16)_(y.ssanoha)
body:
An [[original]] [[personification]] of the Essex-class aircraft carrier [i]USS Lexington[/i] created by [[y.ssanoha]]. Based on [[Essex (Warship Girls R)|]] and [[Lexington (Warship Girls R)|]] of [[Warship Girls R]].

She is often depicted as a constant victim of Saratoga, who sees her as a stand in for CV-2 and continues to sexually harass her.

Like all Essex-class, she wears a black suit with white mini-skirt and breast plate, carries a black flight deck marked with her hull number, and usually has an expressionless face with flat gaze. Inheriting the spirit of the original Lexington, she wears a light blue beret with feathers on side identical to the white and feathered beret CV-2 Lexington was wearing, and shares the same hair style with her. Additionally, her breast plate is light blue, identical to the color of CV-2's beret.

Later, the Essex-class [[lexington_(cv-16)_(warship_girls_r)|Lexington (CV-16)]] were added into the game as a separate shipgirl from original Lexington (CV-2).

title: british_admiral_(y.ssanoha)
body:
Artist y.ssanoha's British admiral. He has a stereotypical Jackie Chan style huge nose, and blond hair. His eyes are always hidden under the shade of his peaked admiral cap, in the rare cases of cap removal, he will either cover his upeer face, or simply let the frame censor him.
A particularly mean spirited chap, likes trolling his shipgirls. HMS Unicorn is one of his constant victims.

Only appears in y.ssanoha's strips when he is making fun of [[Azur Lane]] and [[Warship Girls R]]'s British origin shipgirls.

title: robotech:_the_motion_picture
body:
An unmade live action film adaptation of the first arc of the [[Robotech]] [[mecha]] anime adaptation from the 80s. 

The movie was going to be based on the [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|Macross Saga]] and had some pre-production art made for it. Work on the project started in the late 2000s.

It was being produced by actor "Tobey Macguire":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobey_Maguire (himself a Robotech fan). The adaptation is currently in development hiatus limbo.

Some of its planned effects and design elements and/or styles are rumored in Hollywood circles to have ended up being used in other productions like the later [[transformers_(live action)|live action Transformers films]] by Michael Bay and the [[Pacific Rim]] movies.

title: ctsfo
body:
A Counter-Terrorism Specialist Firearm Officer (CTSFO) is a United Kingdom police frearms officer. The CTSFO standard is currently the highest level of Authorised Firearms Officer in the National Police Firearms Training Curriculum. It was established by the Metropolitan Police Service (MPS).

The MPS have established the Specialist Firearm Command (SCO19), which has seven teams of CTSFO officers within it. They are commonly depicted with identification patches on the upper arm, which includes their team number, alongside the bottom leftmost corner being a colour dependant on their team.

CTSFOs are equipped with the [[sig mcx]].

h4. Related Tags
* [[police]]
* [[metropolitan_police_service]]

title: sig_p210
body:
A locked breech semi-automatic [[handgun]] designed in 1947 and manufactured by [[sig sauer|SIG]] from 1949 until temporary discontinuation in 2005. The [[weapon]] features an M1911-style trigger, all-metal frame and uses single-stack magazine. The P210 was adopted by the Swiss Army until 1975.

h1. External links
* "SIG Sauer website":https://www.sigsauer.com/firearms/pistols/p210.html

body:

Japanese Name: 夢のつばさ

title: custom_maid_3d
body:
Custom Maid 3D (CM3D) is a CG adult game developed by KISS and released on January 28, 2011.  Predecessor to [[Custom Maid 3D 2]] (CM3D2) and [[Custom Order Maid 3D 2|Custom Order Maid 3D2]] (COM3D2).

The game featured a large character creation setup to let players create maids that they would train and have sex with.  Features a mode allowing one to setup a stage and position characters as one would like.  This mode, along with various mods, allowed the game to serve as a platform for people to create CG images of characters in various poses and setups.

title: custom_maid_3d_2
body:

The game featured a large character creation setup to let players create maids that they would train and have sex with.  Features a studio mode allowing one to setup a stage and position characters as one would like.  This mode, along with various mods, allowed the game to serve as a platform for people to create CG images of characters in various poses and setups.

title: custom_order_maid_3d_2
body:
Custom Order Maid 3D2 (COM3D2) is a CG adult game developed by KISS and released in February 23, 2018.  Successor to [[Custom Maid 3D 2]] (CM3D2).

title: spider-boy_(spider-man)
body:
[[Bailey Briggs]] is a 10 year old kid who was removed from the 616 timeline. The Home Dimension of the Marvel Universe. 
He is not to be confused with the Spider-boy from the amalgamation universe which was combination of the DC and Marvel Universe heroes. Notably Superboy and Spider-man. 

What we know about Briggs so far is that: He's been Spider-boy for 3 years, according to him. Meaning he started when he was 7. Dan Slott clarified on twitter, the creator of Spider-boy, that means that Briggs started around the Spider-man event called "Big Time"!

His powers seem to be similar to Peter's in that he has superior strength and the ability to stick to walls. Except that his Spider Sense seems to warn him of upcoming peril. Leading him on as he likes to call them, "Side-Quests"!

He also seems to begrudgingly use the word, Side-kick when referring to him and Spider-man's relationship. 

We don't yet know why he was removed from the 616 timeline, but given Spider-man's reaction to Briggs being Spider-boy in the current 616 timeline and that he hadn't [b]earned[/b] his webshooters yet from the previous 616 timeline (according to Briggs). It's more then likely Peter might have altered the previous 616 timeline by removing Briggs from it, thinking he was saving the kid from a life of super heroics rather then dooming him to be forgotten in the new current 616 timeline. 

Think Spider-man in No Way Home when he had Dr. Strange erase himself from people's memories in the MCU, if that helps.  
except it's way worse because Briggs no long has a mother, nor does anyone remember him personally along with his secret identity. 

* [[spider-man]]

title: corded_phone
body:
The oldest of all [[phone|phones]], dominant in everyday use at least until the early 1990s. Uses cords to maintain electricity. Most often has a [[rotary phone|rotary dial]], although these were gradually superseded by push button systems from the 1980s onward.

The earliest corded phones had no integrated dialing system at all; either the connection was between two devices only, or a manual telephone exchange was needed.

The corded phone has generally been superseded by cordless phones and cellphones, but are still common in some fields.  Public phones such as payphones and emergency phones are corded either to discourage someone walking off with the receiver or because the time between uses would be far between.  Office/business phones are also commonly wired, due to considerations such of potential radio interference in an office environment where there may be many phones and wireless devices in close proximity and in consideration of corporate security.

title: mercedes-benz_amg_gt
body:
A high-performance [[sports car]] produced by [[Mercedes-Benz]]. Began production in 2014, replacing the [[mercedes-benz sls amg|SLS AMG]].

The AMG GT has GT4, GT3, and GT2 homologated [[racecar]] variants, and is extremely popular in every class it is available in. The GT3 version is used in the [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]], [[GT World Challenge Europe]] (as well as the other GTWC regions), [[Super GT]], [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters]], and various other leagues throughout the world. The platform's motorsport popularity is attributed to several factors, including it's affordability (relative to other cars in the same class), how easily controllable it is for amateur drivers, and a solid customer support system from Mercedes.

 [[GOODSMILE Racing]] has been using the AMG GT for several years, and as a result it is often featured in [[Racing Miku]] merchandise and artwork.

title: kappa
body:
A kappa (河童 (かっぱ), lit. [i]river child[/i]) is a type of water sprite found in Japanese folklore. It is famous for its love of [[cucumber]]s and also its odd eating habits, such as feeding on hapless victims by sucking out the entrails through the [[anus]]; this leads to its other name: [[shirikodama]] (anus) vampire.

Their appearance varies; some are drawn with an ape-like face or a bird [[beak]], hair circling the skull, tortoise shell, and scaly body. Notable characteristics include humanoid (child size), a water-filled head depression, and [[webbed feet]] and hands.

h4. See also

* [[Kawashiro Nitori]]
* [[traditional youkai]]
* [[Tag group:Legendary creatures]]

h4. External links

* "More info on Kappa":http://www.onmarkproductions.com/html/kappa.shtml

title: slow_motion_gun_animation_(meme)
body:
Slow Motion Gun Animations, also known as "Mississippi Queen" Gun Videos, are a series of exploitable memes revolved around captioning a slow-motion, 3D gun animation shooting a bullet out of its barrel with the 1970 rock song "Mississippi Queen" by Mountain playing in the background. The captions are most often related to a humorous scenario in which the solution is shooting a gun and killing something, contrasted by the overdramatic and righteous nature of the gun graphic and the song. The trend started on iFunny in 2022, spreading throughout the latter part of the year.

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/slow-motion-gun-animations
* "Mississippi Queen by Mountain on YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VbP4qf8PjfI

title: satellite_cannon
body:
A [[weapon]] in the [[After War Gundam X]] universe. Equipped on the [[Gundam X]] and [[GX-Bit|GX-Bits]], this extremely powerful [[beam cannon]] is powered by a microwave beam from a moon station and is capable of destroying a [[space habitat]]. 

There are 2 variations of this weapon in the After War timeline: 

1) [i]Twin Satellite Cannon[/i] - A doubled version which has more than twice the firepower of the original. Equipped onto the [[Gundam Double X]]. 

2) [I]Satellite Launcher[/i] - A longer-barreled version that is as powerful as the Double X' Twin Satellite Cannon. The weapon itself is equipped onto the [[Gundam Ashtaron Hermit Crab]] and requires it to be in its MA Mode to be used while the energy collecting parts are installed onto the [[Gundam Virsago Chest Break]].

h4. See also

* [[Reflexive satellite cannon]] ([[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]])

title: buster_rifle
body:
A type of fictional weapon appearing in [[Gundam Wing]]. 

The signature weapon of [[Wing Gundam]], loaded with three energy cartridges. While it functions like a regular beam rifle, its output is adjustable, with a full powered, single shot capable of destroying multiple [[Mobile Suit|Mobile Suits]] at the expense of consuming a full energy cartridge.

It is loaded with three energy cartridges. Thus, the Buster Rifle can only fire full powered shots up to three times before needing a reload. 

[[Wing Gundam Zero]] and [[Wing Gundam Zero Custom]] are both equipped with [i]Twin Buster Rifle[/i], a double-barreled version which has more than twice the firepower of the Wing's Buster Rifle and a full powered, single shot from the former is capable of destroying a [[space habitat]]. It can also be split into a pair of guns for [[dual wielding]] purposes, such as the [i]Rolling Buster Rifle[/i] attack. Lastly, it can fire full powered shots several times without running out of energy due to it being powered by the Gundam's reactor instead of using energy cartridges.

title: wing_gundam_zero
body:
[b]XXXG-00W0 Wing Gundam Zero [/b]
The first Gundam designed by the 5 scientists who developed the Gundams used for Operation Meteor. Resembling one of its lower-spec descendant units, the [[Wing Gundam]], it also transforms into a flight form called the [I]Neo Bird Mode[/I] and is equipped with Twin [[Buster Rifle]], which has more than twice the power of the latter's single Buster Rifle and is capable of destroying a [[space habitat]] in a single, full powered shot. 

It is also equipped with the [I]ZERO System[/I], an interface for achieving the "perfect victory", developed to make the pilot keep up with a machine performance that surpasses the [[Tallgeese]]. However, it seriously affects the physical functions and mental state of the pilot. Thus, a pilot without strong mental strength can't control it and will be overwhelmed by the system instead. The dangers of the ZERO System, as well as the excessive power of the Twin Buster Rifle, are the reasons why after designing the Wing Zero, it wasn't built until After Colony 195 (and it was built by [[Quatre Raberba Winner]] instead, who found the design blueprints while undergoing a personal crisis). In its place, 5 Gundams derived from its design are developed for the Operation Meteor.

It has multiple pilots in the entire [[Gundam Wing]] TV series, but its most well-known pilot is [[Heero Yuy]], who is able to master its ZERO System and also, the most successful in piloting the Gundam itself. 

The Wing Gundam Zero also appears in [I]The Glory of Losers[/I] manga as the [I]Wing Gundam Proto Zero[/I], with minor changes on its design due it being designed by [[Katoki Hajime]]. 

This tag refers to [[Ookawara Kunio]]'s original design of the Wing Gundam Zero or [[Katoki Hajime]]'s Proto Zero. Not to be confused with [[Katoki Hajime]]'s [[Wing Gundam Zero Custom]] or [[Wing Gundam (EW)|Wing Gundam redesign]].

title: canute
body:
Canute (or Cnut) the Great (Old Norse: Knútr inn ríki, Danish: Knud den Store, Norwegian: Knut den mektige) (994/995 – November 12, 1035) was king of England, Denmark, and Norway and governor or overlord of Schleswig and Pomerania.  The 2nd son King Sweyn Forkbeard of Denmark. Canute's mother was Gunhild (formerly Swiatoslawa, daughter of Mieszko I of Poland).

Appears as a character in Vinland Saga (Japanese: ヴィンランド・サガ, Hepburn: Vinrando Saga) written and illustrated by Makoto Yukimura.

title: shaman_king
body:
A Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Hiroyuki Takei that was serialized in the Weekly Shōnen Jump between 1998 and 2004 and has been collected in thirty-two tankōbon volumes. Shaman King follows the adventures of Asakura Yoh as he attempts to hone his shaman skills to become the Shaman King in the Shaman tournament.

The manga has been adapted into an animated television series produced by Xebec and co-produced by TV Tokyo. The series has also spawned numerous video games, a trading card game as well as many types of Shaman King-related merchandise.

title: vita_(nanoha)
body:
A character introduced in [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's]].

She appears in neither the previous series [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha]] nor the later story [[Triangle Heart]], but she does appear in [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha StrikerS]]. Vita is one of the Wolkenritter, a creation of the Book of Darkness. She is the most devoted of the four to [[Yagami Hayate]], their mistress.

Vita's weapon is a mallet called [[Graf Eisen]], and as a magical creation, she has no familiar. She is named for the Opel Vita, much like characters of [[Magic Knight Rayearth]] are named for cars (for example, Opel Zafira).

She has [[orange hair|orange]] [[twin braids]] and [[blue eyes]], and wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[beret]] and [[red dress]].

She is voiced by [[Sanada Asami]].

h4. See also

* [[Graf Eisen]]

title: jp_(street_fighter)
body:
Aliases: Johan Petrovich, Jean-Philippe

A character from [[Street Fighter]], first debuted in [[Street Fighter 6]] and serving as the game's antagonist.

[spoiler]Prior to the fall of Shadaloo, JP served under [[m. bison|M. Bison]] as the head financial manager and has mastered the use of Psycho Power at some point. After the fall of Shadaloo, JP created a terrorist and criminal organization named Amnesia and is involved in many investment projects in several countries, only to cause chaos in these countries as a front for his criminal activities. In the beginning of Street Fighter 6 story, he framed [[Ken masters|Ken]] for funding his own Amnesia group and forcing him to bear the responsibility of JP's own crimes that Ken did not commit.[/spoiler]

h5. Official Bio

Head of an international NGO responsible for many successful investment projects, and the man behind Nayshall's present prosperity. Has a beloved cat named Cybele.

[b]Hates: [/b]Stains on his clothes, sleep
[b]Likes: [/b]Chess puzzles, cleaning, local cuisines
[b]Height: [/b]191cm / 6'3"
[b]Weight: [/b]97kg / 214 lbs
other_names: JP(ストリートファイター)
ヨハン・パブロビッチ

title: seth_(street_fighter)
body:
The main antagonist of [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]. He is the head of Shadaloo's weapon division, S.I.N. According to the official Street Fighter website, Seth is one of many genetically engineered replacement bodies for [[M. Bison]].

Seth returns in [[Street Fighter V]] as [[Female Seth (street fighter)|]]. With his body destroyed at the end of Street Fighter IV, his surviving brain is combined with the body of a [[Shadaloo Dolls|Shadaloo Doll]] named Unit Zero, resulting in Seth adapting a new female appearance.

h4. See also

* [[Female Seth (Street Fighter)|]]
other_names: セス(ストリートファイター)

title: charlie_nash
body:
Central character in the [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]] series of fighting games.

He wears green [[cargo pants]] and a light yellow [[flak jacket]]. He has [[glasses]] which he takes off before a fight, and an exaggerated hairstyle consisting of a large forelock of [[blonde hair|blond hair]]. The glasses are not necessary for him to see, and appear to be purely cosmetic.

He is a calm and confident fighter - sometimes to a fault - with a strong sense of justice. He has a crime-fighting attitude akin to his friend [[Guile]], though more out of righteousness rather than revenge; even so, he sometimes acts reckless. While normally he acts in a professional manner, he does let his emotions get the better of him at times. He greatly values his allies.

[spoiler]He died in a battle against Shadaloo dictator [[M. Bison]] by sacrificing himself to save Guile and [[Chun-Li]], who in turn also hated the dictator for revenge.
other_names: ナッシュ(ストリートファイター)

title: thunder_hawk
body:
[b]Thunder Hawk[/b] is one of the four new characters introduced in the Super [[Street Fighter II (series)|]] fighting [[video game]]. 

A member of the fictional Thunderfoot clan, T. Hawk's homeland was taken over thirty years prior to the events of the game by [[M. Bison|M. Bison]], who also murdered his father, Arroyo Hawk. T. Hawk enters the tournament to reclaim his homeland from Bison. 

During the development of Super Street Fighter II, T. Hawk was originally named "Geronimo", a name which was changed after it was suggested by an American staff member that the name Geronimo might be seen as racially offensive.

T. Hawk, since his introduction, has been billed from Mexico. This was because there were already 3 characters from the United States ([[Ken Masters]], [[Guile]] and [[Balrog (street fighter)|]]). Though some Mexican players felt "cultural ignorance" from [[Capcom]] by billing a [[Native American]] from Mexico, his backstory explains he was born in the Sonora desert and resides in the Monte Albán plains.

title: street_fighter_(movie)
body:
The live-action movie adaptation of [[Street Fighter II (series)|]], starring [[Jean-Claude Van Damme]] as [[Guile]] and [[Raul Julia]] as [[M. Bison]].

While the movie is notorious for being unfaithful to the source material, it became a cult classic among the Street Fighter fans, and features a lot of memorable and quotable dialogue.

title: rose_(street_fighter)
body:
[b]Rose[/b] is a fighter from [[capcom|Capcom's]] [[Street Fighter]] series of fighting games. Her Zodiac Sign is Cancer. She has the ability to control a special energy known as [i]Soul Power[/i] (the polar opposite of [[M. bison|M. Bison's]] [i]Psycho Power[/i]).

Rose is a fortune teller from Genoa and sensed that Doomsday was approaching, and knew a person of great evil was causing it. In [[street_fighter_zero_(series)|Street Fighter Zero 2]] She found the source of the evil in Vega and defeats him, thinking she has rid the world of him for good. Unfortunately, by reading her tarot cards she discovered Vega was still alive. 

In Street Fighter Zero 3, she faces Vega once again and finds out that she and Vega share the same soul. She faces Vega once more and rams her fist through his chest, channeling her energy into his body. Rose used all of her soul powers to defeat Vega, but it was not enough so Rose fell to the ground. There she lay unconscious where [[Guy (final fight)|Guy]] (who she meets earlier on when he goes after Shadaloo) finds her. When Vega was defeated by [[ryu (street fighter)|Ryu]] (who destroyed his body temporarily in the process), Vega's soul went to the Psycho Drive then [[Charlie Nash]] sacrificed his own life in attempt to killing him but he had no success, Vega's soul went to Rose's body making her his temporary host.
other_names: ローズ(ストリートファイター)

title: nissan_fairlady
body: Otherwise known as [b]Datsun Sports[/b], a series of roadsters produced by [[Nissan]] in the 1960s. The series was a predecessor to the [[Nissan Fairlady Z|Z-car]] in the Fairlady line, and offered an inexpensive alternative to the British MG and Triumph sports cars. The line began with the 1959 "S211" and continued through 1970 with the "SP311" and "SR311" line.

title: kokushibou
body:
He is a major supporting antagonist of [[Kimetsu no Yaiba]]. He is a demon affiliated with the Twelve Kizuki, holding the highest position, Upper Rank One.
As a demon, Kokushibou took the form of a pale-skinned, tall and muscular man with long and spiky black hair with red tips that he kept in a ponytail. His most notable feature is the three sets of eyes on his face with yellow irises and red sclera that have black straight lines diverging from each iris. His middle set of eyes features the kanji of "Upper Rank" and "One ". Kokushibo also has red markings resembling flames on the top left side of his forehead and the bottom right of his chin. His appearance was described to be extremely dignified and majestic by the Mist Hashira, Muichiro Tokito. Kokushibou wore a purple-and-black bee-hive patterned nagagi kimono and black umanori-styled hakama pants tied with a white uwa-obi. He carried a fleshy katana at his waist that had eyes in the space between the tsuka ito wrapping of the handle of his sword. The tsuba and blade were also later revealed to have eyes and veins.
[spoiler] He's the demon form of [[Tsugikuni Michikatsu]]. He's also the ancestor of [[Tokitou Muichirou|Muichiro Tokito]] and [[Tokitou Yuichirou|Yuichiro Tokito]] and the one responsible for turning Zenitsu Agatsuma's senior, [[Kaigaku]], into a demon and joining the Twelve Kizuki. And he is [[Tsugikuni Yoriichi]]'s older twin brother, the strongest Demon Slayer that ever existed.[/spoiler]

h4. External Links
* "Kimetsu no Yaiba Wiki: Kokushibo":https://kimetsu-no-yaiba.fandom.com/wiki/Kokushibo

title: tsugikuni_yoriichi
body:
He's a major supporting character of [[Kimetsu no Yaiba]]. [spoiler] He is a legendary Demon Slayer who lived nearly 500 years ago during the Sengoku Era, as well as the strongest Demon Slayer to have ever existed. He is also the inventor of Breathing Styles, being the one who created the first ever Breathing Style that would eventually become the Hinokami Kagura used by [[Kamado Tanjirou]] and members of the Kamado Family.[/spoiler]

Like his twin brother, Yoriichi is a tall and muscular man with long and spiky hair with red tips that he kept in a ponytail. However, unlike him he was slightly more slender and had shorter bangs and wavier hair than his brother. His Demon Slayer Mark was at the same place at the top of his forehead as Tanjiro, albeit lighter in color. Yoriichi is always seen with a solemn and calm look on his face, rarely showing emotion.

Yoriichi wore a red haori over a very pale orange-colored nagagi kimono with a black umanori-styled hakama, a pair of zōri with red straps and white tabi socks, with a Nichirin Sword carried at the left side of his waist, conventional to most Demon Slayers. He sported [[hanafuda earrings]] created by his mother as charms when he was thought to be deaf; he later gave them to his friend Sumiyoshi, who then passed the earrings down to his descendants and eventually Tanjirou as well.

[spoiler] He is [[Tsugikuni_Michikatsu|Michikatsu's younger twin brother]] who later became a demon and joined the Twelve Kizuki.[/spoiler]

h4. External Links
* "Kimetsu no Yaiba Wiki: Yoriichi Tsugikuni":https://kimetsu-no-yaiba.fandom.com/wiki/Yoriichi_Tsugikuni

title: nanatsu_no_maken_ga_shihai_suru
body:
A fantasy light novel series by Uno Bokuto with illustrations by [[Miyuki Ruria]]. It has been adapted to a Manga drawn by Esuno Sakae and a Summer 2023 TV Anime by J.C.Staff.

The series follows the protagonist Oliver Horn and his friends during their time attending the Kimberly Magic Academy, a 7-year institute noted for its tough environment and courses, but also for the degree of freedom students are granted compared to other academies.

h4. Characters

h5. Main Characters / Sword Roses

body:

Known as [b]Imperator Librarius[/b] in English.

title: bayraktar
body:
A UAV developed by the Turkish company Baykar, available in both armed and unarmed variants.
The drone would become an icon of the [[Russo-Ukrainian War]] in the wake of the Russian invasion, given Ukraine's highly-effective use of them. Because of this, the drone would even become the topic of a [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XCYuq6bWTAo](song written by the Ukrainian serviceman Taras Borovok).

title: penis_shadow
body:
A shadow cast by a [[penis]] (or [[phallic_symbol|something shaped like a penis]]), usually on a character's face.

This tag applies even when the real [[penis]] is not exposed. If the penis is visible, add the [[penis]] tag.

If the object casting the penis-shaped shadow is actually something innocuous, add the [[phallic symbol]] tag as well.

Not to be confused with [[invisible penis]], which is when the penis itself is drawn as a shadowy shape.

h4. See also

* [[Penis awe]]
* [[Penis on head]]

title: k_(blade_runner_2049)
body:
A character and main protagonist of the [[Blade Runner 2049]] science fiction film from 2017.

He is played by [[canada|Canadian]] actor [[Ryan Gosling]].

[b]K[/b], [spoilers]also known as [b]Joe[/b], is a Nexus-9 (Wallace-1) [[replicant]] blade runner working for the L.A.P.D. (Los Angeles Police Department) under the command of chief Joshi in the year 2049. He has both 'A' physical (superhuman strength and endurance) and mental (genius type) levels. His serial number is KD6-3.7. Agent K has also an A.I. girlfriend called [[Joi]].[/spoilers]

title: 5th_grade_loli
body: A [[meme]] associated with [[Komeiji Satori]]. It's a visual pun: The word 悟り (which means "enlightenment" and is pronounced as [i]satori[/i], although it's not written the same as Satori's name) can be broken down into constituent radicals as 小五ロリ, which roughly means "5th grade elementary school [[loli]]".

title: satchan_(yuureidoushi_(yuurei6214))
body:
Character in Yuureidoushi's ''The Reiga Youkai Consultation Agency''.

A chibi-sized satori, she is [[satori (youkai)|accurately portrayed as a monkey-like girl]] instead of [[komeiji_satori|a girl with a heart-eye appendage]]. She has the power to read minds and broadcast those of whom she is touching at the moment. While she tends to be as mischievous as a monkey, she is actually very loyal with Nagomi, even before she could see her for the first time.

title: barbenheimer_(meme)
body:
Barbenheimer, also known as Barbie Heimer, is a portmanteau of the words "Barbie" and "Oppenheimer" in reference to the 2023 movies Barbie and Oppenheimer, which were released on the same date (July 21st, 2023), causing a slew of  [[Barbie (live action)|]] vs. [[Oppenheimer (movie)|]] memes that humorously combined the contrasting aesthetics and themes of both films. Several iterations of the meme include other properties that share the same date, notably [[Pikmin 4]] (also releasing July 21st) and [[Shin Kamen Rider]] (appearing on streaming globally via Amazon Prime Video July 21st).

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Barbenheimer":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/barbenheimer]
* "Wikipedia: Barbenheimer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barbenheimer]

title: walther_p38
body:
A 9×19mm semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b] that was developed by Carl [[Walther]] GmbH for [[Wehrmacht]] service at the beginning of [[World War II]], introduced in 1939. It was intended to replace the costly and primitive [[Luger P08]]. The [b]Walther P38[/b] is recognizable by its short, open-top slide that exposes the barrel and a rounded trigger guard. The mechanism itself influenced many modern handguns, such as the Beretta 92.

This tag also apply to some post-WWII variants such as the West German Walther P1 and South African Walther P4.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[P38 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Walther P38":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walther_P38

title: afrika_korps
body:
Also known as the [b]German Africa Corps[/b] or by its [[germany|German]] name, [i]Deutsches Afrikakorps[/i] (DAK), it was the German expeditionary force in [[Africa]] during the North African Campaign in [[World War II]]. First sent as a holding force to shore up the [[italy|Italian]] defense of their African colonies, the formation fought on in Africa from March 1941 until its surrender in May 1943.

The unit's best known commander was Field Marshal [[Erwin Rommel]].

h4. Notable battles

* [[First Battle of El Alamein]]
* [[Second Battle of El Alamein]]

h4.External Link

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Afrika_Korps]

title: nu_(kage_no_jitsuryokusha_ni_naritakute!)
body:
A human girl who was discarded by her family due to possession and later rescued by Shadow Garden. Due to her prowess, she quickly rose through the rank of Shadow Garden and attained her status as a "Named Number". Her real name is Nicoletta Marquez and she was the fiancée of Marco Granger.

She's the first possessed "Human" to join the Shadow Garden, as human possession are extremely rare and hold a special meaning. The other known human possession are Claire Kagenou and Rose Oriana.

title: clone_high
body: Clone High (occasionally referred to in the United States as Clone High USA) is a Canadian-American adult animated science fiction sitcom created by Phil Lord, Christopher Miller and Bill Lawrence. Set at a high school populated by the [[clone]]s of well-known historical figures, the series follows its central cast includes adolescent depictions of [[abraham lincoln (clone high)|Abe Lincoln]], [[Joan of Arc (clone high)|]], Gandhi, Cleopatra, and [[john f. kennedy (clone high)|JFK]]. The series also serves as a parody of teen dramas such as Dawson's Creek and Beverly Hills, 90210.

title: crosier
body:
[i]A [[priest]]'s staff.[/i]

The real-life crosier (also spelled [i]crozier[/i]) is a stylized, often ornately-decorated staff that is a symbol of the governing office of a high-ranking [[Christianity|Christian]] priest. This staff generally comes in three forms: [b]hooked[/b], in the shape of a shepherd's crook (curled off to one side); [b]tau[/b], in the shape of a T with downwards-curving arms topped by a small [[cross]]; and [b]serpentine[/b], with a pair of sculptured serpents or dragons curled back to face each other in an upwards-facing U with a small cross between them. 

The [[fantasy]] version of the crosier tends to resemble a bastardized version of one (or several) of the above, with a small sphere or circular symmetrical  "shepherd's crook" bisected or topped by a large cross (the overall profile will often resemble a [[Celtic cross]]). Some versions may just be a large cross mounted on the end of a staff (with the whole staff resembling a [[Latin cross]], like the [[Pope]]'s [i]ferula[/i]). Another common fantasy variant has a scepter-like head topped off with a small cross.

[[Priest]]s and fantasy [[priestess]]es are often depicted holding a crosier. Some may instead be depicted wielding a generic [[mage staff]]; such examples should not be tagged crosier.

h4. Notable examples
* [[Arch bishop (ragnarok online)|]] ([[Ragnarok Online]])
* [[Pope_(ragnarok_online)|The Pope]] ([[Ragnarok Online]])
* [[Martha_(fate)|]] ([[Fate (series)]])
* [[Victorious_(azur lane)|]] ([[Azur Lane]])
** Wields a golden crosier tipped with a sun cross, surmounted with a ship's bell.
* [[Fan la Norne]] ([[Xenoblade Chronicles 2]])

h4. Tag usage notes
* Tag crosier for the priest's staff described above—both the real versions and the fantasy variants.
** As a general rule, any fantasy staff that appears vaguely [[christianity|Christian]]-like (i.e. festooned with crosses and Christian motifs) will also tend to qualify.
* Avoid tagging crosier for 'generic' looking staves that may be better off tagged [[staff]] or [[mage staff]].
** Fantasy [[priest]]([[priestess|ess]])es are sometimes depicted holding a 'generic' crystal or gem-tipped staff without any religious trappings, one that would not look out of place being wielded by any other magic user. These examples should be tagged [[mage staff]] and not crosier.
** Fire Emblem characters belonging to the priest or cleric class lines tend to just wield generic [[mage staff|mage staves]] because of [[Nintendo]] being allergic towards the depiction of crosses and other religious iconography.
* [b]Do not[/b] tag [[shakujou]] (i.e. Buddhist staves) with crosier.
* The [[Pope]]'s staff is a Papal ferula, but this can be tagged with crosier for now.

h4. See also
* [[Priest]]
* [[Priestess]]
* [[Mage staff]]
* [[Shakujou]] [tn]Buddhist equivalent, topped with multiple metal rings.[/tn]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Crosier":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crosier]
* "Wikipedia: Papal Ferula":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Papal_ferula] 
** The [[Pope]]'s staff. Technically different, but currently tagged as same (because fantasy [[Priest]]s also tend to carry a similar staff).

title: another_eden
body:
[B]Another Eden: The Cat Beyond Time and Space[/B] is a JRPG developed by Wright Flyer Studios (WFS). The story involves time travel as well as other science fiction and fantasy elements. The game is written by Kato Masato and the main theme is composed by Mitsuda Yasunori, both of whom previously worked on [[Chrono Trigger]]. There are a number of references to the [i]Chrono[/i] series in the game. 

Another Eden is available on Android, iOS, and will be ported to Nintendo Switch in the future. The game is a single-player adventure that users may play at their own pace: all story content is permanent with no time limit, and the game lacks stamina timers. All main characters and many additional characters are free, unlocked as players progress. Other extra characters may be unlocked through an optional gacha system, the only form of monetization in the free-to-play game. Another Eden was first released in Japan on 2017 April 12. The global release began rolling out to other countries on 2019 January 28. 

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Aldo (another eden)|]], the protagonist
* [[Feinne (another eden)|]], Aldo's sister
* [[Amy (another eden)|]], a human from the future who fights Synths
* [[Riica (another eden)|]], an android girl from the future
* [[Cyrus (another eden)|]], a frog knight from antiquity
* [spoiler][[Helena (another eden)|]][/spoiler]

h6. Antiquity

* [[King Palsifal]]

h6. Present

* [[Varuo (another eden)|]], Feinne and Aldo's cat
* [[Guildna (another eden)|]], the Beast King
* [[Altena (another eden)|]], Guildna's sister

h6. Future

* [[Galiard]], commander of the Synth army
* [[Helena (another eden)|]], a Synth woman
* [[The Riftbreaker]], a flying battleship
* [[Isuka (another eden)|]], IDA Academy student council president

h4. External links

* "Official site (EN)":https://en.another-eden.jp
* "Official site (JP)":https://another-eden.jp
* "App (Android)":https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=games.wfs.anothereden

title: the_day_the_earth_stood_still
body:
[b]The Day the Earth Stood Still[/b] is a 1951 American [[science fiction]] film from 20th Century Fox, produced by Julian Blaustein and directed by Robert Wise. Set in the [[Cold War]] during the early stages of the nuclear arms race, the storyline involves a humanoid alien visitor who comes to Earth, accompanied by a powerful [[robot]], to deliver an important message that will affect the entire human race.

The newer adaptation of "the same name":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Day_the_Earth_Stood_Still_(2008_film) was released in 2008.

h1. External links
* "IMDb":https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0970416/
* "Wikipedia: The Day the Earth Stood Still":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Day_the_Earth_Stood_Still

title: maggie_gordon
body:
A fictional female character from the film [[The Last Starfighter]].

[b]Maggie Gordon[/b] is the girlfriend of [[Alex Rogan]].

In [[real life]] she was played by [[canada|Canadian]] actress "Catherine Mary Stewart":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catherine_Mary_Stewart .

title: star_league
body:
A fictional organization from [[The Last Starfighter]] film released in 1984.

The [b]Star League[/b] was created by several free planets attempting to combat the might of the sinister and powerful "Ko-Dan Armada":https://thelaststarfighter.fandom.com/wiki/Kodan_Armada bent on conquering the different populated worlds of the [[milky way]] [[galaxy]].

The League has its main base of operations in planet Rylos, where it operates the [[Gunstar One]] [[starfighter]]s which are deployed to defend the Galactic Frontier against hostile attack fleets.

title: the_last_starfighter
body:
[b]The Last Starfighter[/b] is a 1984 [[united_states|American]] [[science fiction]] space opera film directed by Nick Castle. 

The film tells the story of [[Alex Rogan]] (played by Lance Guest), an idealisitic young man and gifted [[video game]]r [spoiler]recruited by an [[alien]] [[star_league|defense force]] to fight in an interstellar war due to his superior gaming skills.[/spoiler]

The movie also features Robert Preston (as [[Centauri]], his final role in a theatrical film), Dan O'Herlihy, Catherine Mary Stewart (as [[Maggie Gordon]]), Norman Snow, and Kay E. Kuter.

The Last Starfighter, along with [[Disney]]'s [[TRON]], has the distinction of being one of cinema's earliest films to use extensive "real-life" [[3D|computer-generated imagery (CGI)]] to depict its many starships, environments and battle scenes.

h4. See also

* [[Gunstar One]]

title: weatheroid
body:
An android weathergirl character of a Japanese weather forecasting company [[Weathernews]].

Official name: WEATHEROID Type A Airi [tn](though other types do not yet exist)[/tn]
"Airi" comes from "Yamagishi Airi":[https://twitter.com/airin0609], a weather reporter at Weathernews who is the "voice model" and "manager" of Weatheroid. Airi is often referred to by fans as "Ponko", which later became official.

Debuting in 2012, she's considered a forerunner to [[virtual YouTuber]]s, one of many Pioneers, and would later join them as well.

There was a contest to design the character (see [[Weatheroid Contest]]); 
Here's the profile for Weatheroid that was provided for the contest: 
[quote]WEATHEROID Type A（Airi） 
プロフィール：（女性）年齢：24歳／身長：158cm 
得意なジャンル：高層天気図 
好きな空：飛行機雲のできた青空 
拡張機能：虹アラーム 
推奨気圧：1030hPa~1052hPa（高気圧） 
愛称：アイリン 
CV：山岸愛梨 
天気予報の特徴：天気で元気を伝えるのがモットー。ダジャレやコメント仕立ての天気予報をするのが特徴。[/quote] 

Translation from "here.":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2012-01-07/nico-nico-holds-weatheroid-character-design-contest 

[quote]Weatheroid Type A (Airi) 
Profile: Female  Age: 24   Height: 158 cm 
Forte: High-altitude weather maps 
Favorite sky: Blue sky with jet streams 
Recommended air pressure: 1030 hPa to 1052 hPa (High) 
Nickname: "Ailin" 
Voice actress: Airi Yamagishi 
Unique traits in weather forecasts: Her motto is spreading good cheer through weather. Her specialty is forecasting the weather with puns. 
[/quote]

h4. External links

* "YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/@weatheroidAiriChannel
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/TypeA_Airi

title: weatheroid_contest
body:
Nico Nico Seiga ran a character design contest for [[Weatheroid]], a character for [[Weathernews]]. 

The contest took entries from 2011-12-22 to 2012-01-22. 

There were 3 finalists entries, with post #1102935 winning overall. The runner-ups were post #1102941, and post #1102943. The overall winner won 100,000 yen while the runner-ups got 50,000 yen each.


h4. Links 

* "Contest page":http://info.nicovideo.jp/seiga/weatheroid/

title: cooling_tower
body:
A cooling tower is a heat exchanger that transfers waste heat to the atmosphere through the cooling of a water stream. They can vary in size from small roof-top units to very large structures, but the most well-known are probably the hyperboloid cooling towers often associated with nuclear power plants.

title: auroran
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]] [[military]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

The [b]TASC-02-SCF "Auroran"[/b] is a variable aerospace combat mecha developed during the late part of the Glorie/[[Zor]] war that was constructed to replace the [[TASC-01-SCF Logan]] used by the [[TASC]]. 

It has the capability to transform into three different modes: [b]Crusader[/b] (fighter), [b]Cross Fighter[/b] (heavy combat helicopter), and [b]Cosmo Sniper[/b] (humanoid). 

Though the new Cosmo Sniper mode was specifically designed to deal with the Zor [[Bioroid]] threat, the Auroran proves only moderately successful, since its debut coincides closely with the creation of an improved model of Bioroid.

The Auroran is [[TASC]] ace [[pilot]] [[Mary Angel]]'s mecha of choice.
